title: A viral onboarding experience
description: No blockchain has a blockbuster onboarding experience. The first to develop a social & viral one will secure majority market share. 🚀

f6_assessments.q0: There is no plan here for the spend of $550,000.
f6_assessments.q1: No plan, no timeline, no budget, no deliverables.
f6_assessments.q2: No deliverables of timelines thus delivery cannot be audited. No metrics for success mentioned.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal has no meaningful contribution or ideas.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposar claims to be an Ex CEO of a software training company. However no credentials have been provided. The proposal has also included meaningless material in the discussion part.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal has nothing meaningful for evaluation.

f6_assessments.q0: Lacking many details especially for such a large ask. While I agree this is a problem that needs to be solved this proposal lacks details and an executable plan.
f6_assessments.q1: Would like more details on your background.
f6_assessments.q2:
I agree onboarding a noob is hard. My girlfriend who is quite smart had many difficulties getting started.

 What does a great onboarding experience look like? Please share examples. 

What are you spending $550,000 on? I would like to see a detailed budget, as well as a proposed solution with wireframes or a mockup.

solution: A UGC education platform that is owned by its early adopters and constantly improved by the legacy left by everyone that passes through it.
experience: Ex-CEO/Founder of listed software training company that won multiple awards inc British Chamber of Commerce's National Business of the Year
